member_organisations:
Members are asked to join by signing a Manifesto of ambitions on the self-care area - or by signing an Memorandum of Understanding to ensure their commitment. At this point members are public entities, professional organisations or networks, or stakeholder engagement professionals. 
 
http://www.scie.eu/join/
fields_of_interest: Consumers, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Public Health
head_office_address: c/o Danish Committee for Health Education
eu_initiatives:
Initiatives on self-management (minor ailments/chronic diseases) 
Initiatives to help tackle the AMR challenge 
Initiatives to improve health literacy
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
Self-Care Week Europe 
We are arranging the basis for a European Self-Care Week with activities across Europe. Using a pledge-based model, we will be providing material for general use and appreciate all support in terms of time, network, ideas, and other resources. 
 
- currently the model is in use in a number of Member States, reaching 25 mio. citizens; we aim to reach even further in terms of countries and citizens to empower them to better wellbeing and better health - and to raise the overall level of health literacy in future years.
goals__remit:
SCIE – or Self-Care Initiative Europe – is a cross-border network initiative working to engage authorities and promote public-private partnerships to support the future of self-care. 
 
 
Our main objectives are to: 
 
1. Work to promote self-care as a concept and practice integral to the sustainability of healthcare ecosystems in the EU so that 
- By 2020 well-being and self-care in a holistic sense  is understood as a concept in Europe by all actors who can have an impact on its success and is embedded as part of the measurement for success of a functioning health ecosystem. 
- We enable all those living in Europe to have timely and affordable access to self-care solutions in complementarity to conventional medicines, prescribed treatments and therapies by 2020. 
 
2. Strengthen the policy, regulatory and practice framework supporting self-care, and to elevate the issues on the policy-making and political agendas. 
 
3. Build capacity and empower the various relevant stakeholders to embed self-care into health and wellbeing (including individuals, employers, economic actors, civil society, public administrations, healthcare manufacturers and providers, payers and communicators)
